title: Create and load fixtures to poulate database with fake data
body:
We need an environment that is fully working, but which has fake data, so we can use it to showcase and test the application. 

Best way to do that is to use fixtures and load them. If we do that, we could even create users to view and test the different roles. They can do whatever they like, at night we reset the data (= load the fixtures again). 

We would need fixtures for:
- users 
- profiles
- schools
- activities
- skills
- rubrics
- schedules
- companies
- teachers
- financials
- enrollments
- attendance
- periods?
- faq (per role?)
- portfolio

Next to filling the application with data, we also need to start marketing and selling the application. 

Seeing who has viewed our application will greatly help, so sending login information for different roles will help us understand who is interested. 
(Visitors can ask to receive login information, which we will then send them).

title: Create separate category PO/VO activities
body:
We now have two kinds of Schedules: 'normal' Brede School or Rich Schoolday. The difference is recorded by setting the Rich_schoolday Boolean to True.

Now we want to enable yet another category, so we want to replace the Rich_schoolday Boolean with a schedule_type field, which (for now) can have the values Brede School, Rich Schoolday or PO/VO.

These options can be set in the Schedule module.

We will launch it alongside the Rich_Schoolday Boolean, so we can use the values of that field to set the correct values for the new schedule_type field.

The default value for the schedule_type is Brede School.

We probably want to use integers as options, just like we do with Status.

On the front-end some things will change once we have this new schedule_type field.

- [ ] Creating a Schedule: radio button to select Schedule type 
- [ ] Reporting: checkboxes to indicate which ScheduleTypes to include
- [ ] Probabbly a complete different "entrance" to find the PO/VO Schedule Type

title: Checkbox and radio-buttons both shown, only checkbox needed #411
Parents can indicate absence of Child

labels.name: Role: Parent
labels.description: Everything that is belongs to the Parent role

body:
We want to give Parents the option to indicate their child will be absent from an Activity (child is sick, has to go to dentist, whatever).

Ideally, we take that information from the school administration system, we are looking into the possibilities.

There are however situations where the Student has attended school (so nothing noted in the School administration system), but will be missing the After School program.

Idea is to offer the option to a Parent to indicate their child will be absent on a given day.

We still need to figure out where en how

title: IC-er can add location to Activity

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
Currently the school-manager can not add or edit (or sometimes even: see) the location of an activity.

Allow them to add, edit, see and print the location of an activity.

title: Improve auto_placement algorithm

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
Related to #419

We want a (or multiple) auto_placement algorithms to place (or "finally enroll") students into activities.

There are several goals or concerns when "auto_placing": 
- optimize participation
- optimize development of Student (multiple talent_areas, multiple different activities)
- equal distribution: enroll students in popular activities only once.

We can have multiple algorithms and we can have school-managers choose between them.

For starters, we should develop a well working algorithm that, well, works.

We can even offer school-managers the choice which algorithm to choose per activity.

title: Student enrollment: avoid doubles

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
if Student is enrolled for activity A on day 1 en time x: unenroll for activity B on same day and time.
Take into account the different Statuses there are for Participation status: 
        INTERESTED = 1, _('Ingeschreven')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_ENROLLED = 2, _('Voorlopig geplaatst')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_DENIED = 3, _('Voorlopig afgewezen')
        AI_ENROLLED = 4, _('Automatisch geplaatst')
        AI_DENIED = 5, _('Automatisch afgewezen')
        FINAL_ENROLLED = 6, _('Definitief geplaatst')
        FINAL_DENIED = 7, _('Definitief niet geplaatst')
        DROPPED_OUT = 8, _('Eerder gestopt')

We have an algorithm that is supposed to do this, but it works crappy, needs to be improved.

It is called auto_placement and can be found in schoolmanager/views.py

title: Check if there are multiple users with same email address
Create PWA/SPA for Parent role

labels.name: Role: Parent
labels.description: Everything that is belongs to the Parent role

body:
These are the current pages for the parent:
https://wijnandb.github.io/screenshots_automated/#/parent

We want the set_consent screen to be displayed immediately after login.
All screens have to be developed "mobile first".
We would like to create a optimal User experience. 

These are the things a Parent needs to do:
- see current schedule
- enroll child for new activities
- register absence for a child
- view information of a child
- edit information of a child
- see Portfolio 

Screens + information to be displayed on each screen: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hxANkJSeHLexSH_XNt5Yk8lKjyNhqTbQjMpSSzenimE/edit

We want to be able to send parents push-messages as well, for instance when placement for anctivity has been finalized, or if it's possible to enroll for a new activity.

title: Use black for automated code formatting.
Integrate tools like flake8 Python linting.
add field IBAN to Company
body:
To process invoices automatically, we need to have the IBAN for each company, to be added to the invoice.

In order to do that, we need to add an IBAN field to the Company model.

The structure of an IBAN is: CCxxBBBBxxxxxxxxx
x stands for a digit 0-9
CC for countrycode, like NL or BE 
BBBB stands for Bankcode, like RABO, ABNA, INGB, BUNQ, et ectera (all letters)

So for the Netherlands we are looking for a field of 18 characters and we could add a function to check if a valid IBAN has been filled out. 

Javascript check: https://github.com/arhs/iban.js

title: Error when creating new Activity
body:
When a user tries to create a new activity or edit an existing one on https://debredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/ppozo/activiteiten/
a 500 error is shown.
This doesn't happen on the local deploy or on the acceptance environment.

Apperently this happens when "DEBUG = False" is set.

I don't understand why this happens, do you @gurmessa ?

For now, the issue is resolved by doing just that, setting DEBUG = False in the production settings on Heroku

title: Horizontal scroll on Attendance page

milestone.title: Sprint 1
milestone.description: Testing how to work with milestones

body:
On the page where Attendance is filled out, we want to implement a horizontal scroll, so all dates are viewable, even on small screens. 

We also want to keep the first column fixed, so the name of the student is in view all the time. 

First get horizontal scrolling working, see [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content)

Then fixate the first column.

See also [Codepen](https://codepen.io/capnhairdo/pen/qBaGRBV)
